column1: Bordeaux–Mérignac Airport (French: Aéroport de Bordeaux-Mérignac) (IATA: BOD
column2: ICAO: LFBD) is the international airport of Bordeaux
column3: in south-western France. It is situated in the commune of Mérignac
column5: within the département of the Gironde. It mainly features flights to metropolitan and leisure destinations in Europe and Northern Africa and serves as a base for easyJet

column1: == History ==
KG 40
column2: the prime land-based maritime patrol Luftwaffe unit was primarily based at Bordeaux-Mérignac during the Occupation of France in World War II.

column1: == Terminals ==
Bordeaux Airport has three passenger buildings:
Terminal A is mainly for international flights
Terminal B  passenger air terminal has two levels and is principally dedicated to Air France traffic between Paris and Bordeaux.

Terminal billi is a separate facility for low cost carriers. It has one floor and has small check-in and arrivals areas as well as a departures area with six aircraft parking positions which are used for walk boarding.  Users of Terminal billi are easyJet

== Access ==
=== Road ===

The airport is accessible by road via the A630 autoroute (exit 11b). There is a shuttle by 30'Direct shuttle serving the Bordeaux Saint-Jean railway station. Bus route 1+ of Transports Bordeaux Métropole serves the city centre.
=== Tram ===
The Bordeaux tramway system does not yet reach the airport
column2: but an extension to Line A is expected to link the airport with the city centre by 2022.
